result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Ladon Perry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron Ladon Perry appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Aaron Ladon Perry.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel provides an update to the Court. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court MODIFIES the no contact order to remove the child from the order and allow for third party contact for the purpose of time with the children.

Defendant Aaron Ladon Perry appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Aaron Ladon Perry.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron L Perry in court, via zoom, with attorney Katherine Graber.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of West Allis police officer Todd Ketterhagen. State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Aaron L Perry in court, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing, State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in the trial court. Court advised defendant of current No Contact Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM028455  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/02/2022 sa

Court ordered no contact with DLTD and her minor children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Aaron L Perry in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Aaron L Perry in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron L Perry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
